intro: Physaria sessilis, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a raceme, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Physaria sessilis is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
